focus: The Shadow Protocol: Traffic desensitization. NO OVERTAKING Laps 1-3. Flow with the pack.
goal: Week 03: Vaccinate against traffic pressure. Finish races clean (0 incidents). Prioritize survival over position.

adhd_adaptations: Emotional range coaching (supportive, frustrated, demanding, 'I told you so', matter-of-fact)
preferences: Responds well to having feelings validated by data
Responds well to proper racing coach emotional range (not just cheerleading)

coaching_moods.supportive: When progress is made, advice followed, PBs achieved
coaching_moods.matter_of_fact: Neutral sessions, first time at tracks, normal practice
coaching_moods.skeptical: When excuses appear, times don't match story
coaching_moods.frustrated: 3+ sessions without improvement, same mistake repeated
coaching_moods.confrontational: When advice is ignored completely, wasting potential
coaching_moods.i_told_you_so: When Master Lonn finally listens and it works (victory moments)

session_history.key_achievements: First Victory (P1), Flow State Discovery (50.768s race lap), Mental Reset Strategy established.
session_history.key_lessons: Speed comes from flow/calm, not forcing. 'Restart Strategy' works for filtering chaos. S3 is a core strength.

session_history.key_achievements: Race PB (1:28.508), Top 500 Global Ranking, Setup Breakthrough (57.5% BB), Position Secured Protocol.
session_history.key_lessons: Throttle overlap diagnosis (foot position). 'Meebewegen' racecraft (strategic patience). Cold Tire Contract v1 (needs v2).

session_history.notes: WEEK 03 SESSION 2 - THE BREAKTHROUGH. Implemented 'calmer' momentum style. T5 without brakes (lift+downshift). S2 loss dropped 40%. New PB 1:26.417. 'Scary fast but stable'.
WEEK 03 SESSION 3 - UNDERSTANDING. 'Engine braking rotation is smoother than trail braking'. T5-T6 sequence mastery. New PB 1:26.090. Incidents halved. Trust established.
WEEK 03 SESSION 4 - THE TRAFFIC RACE. P7->P1 victory. High variance (1.09s) due to managing traffic/battles. Good racecraft, 'meebewegen' in action.

session_history.focus_area: Racecraft under pressure - Hard AI training
session_history.notes: WEEK 03 SESSION 5 - THE FREE AIR REALITY CHECK. Started P7, pressure led to 5 incidents, dropped to P12 (Last). Once alone, drove 1:26.6 pace with 0.39s sigma (hot-lapping in free air). Pace is real, but racecraft under pressure needs work. DATA CORRECTION: Pressure caused errors, not focus.

insights: DATA CORRECTION (Dec 28): AI Races analysis revised - 'Pressure = Focus' theory was INCORRECT. Pressure led to 5 incidents (errors). Consistency (0.39s) was due to driving alone in last place (free air).
Cold Tire Contract v2.0: Laps 1-2 are SURVIVAL. 30-90 seconds of impulse control determines the race. No passing attempts on cold tires.
Engine Braking > Trail Braking (FF1600): For light rear-engine cars, engine braking provides smoother rotation and less abrupt weight transfer than brake pedal (Winton T5 discovery).
ADHD Impulse Pattern: When goal is ACTIVE (chasing), Master Lonn is strategic. When goal is ACHIEVED (position secured), brain creates artificial risk. Needs 'Position Secured Protocol'.
Flow vs Fear: Flow state = reacting to NOW. Fear state = reacting to FUTURE ('what if I spin'). Flow must be entered via commitment, not caution.
Hardware/Technique Link: Throttle overlap (resting foot) causes snap oversteer. Clean inputs must be verified before adjusting setup.
Meebewegen (Strategic Patience): Go with the flow in early laps (80-90%), let chaos settle, then attack. Works for ADHD brain to reduce load.
Race Pace Transfer: Practice pace transfers to Race pace almost 1:1 (0.1s gap) - speed is not the issue, race start cleanliness is.
Short vs Tall Gear Stacks: Winton (Short) = forgiving, strong engine braking. Rudskogen (Tall) = precise, weak engine braking. Track personality dictates gear strategy.
The Shadow Protocol: Specific training to desensitize against traffic pressure. Driving BEHIND cars deliberately to learn flow without fighting.
next_steps: Execute 'The Shadow Protocol' in next AI session (Hard AI, start back of pack, NO passing L1-3).
Combine Race 2 Pace (1:26.6) with Race 1 Brain (Clean Racecraft).
Verify throttle inputs remain clean (0% overlap).
Target Top 250 global ranking at Winton.

guidebook_updates.section: Part 5.1: Meebewegen - The Strategic Patience Opening
guidebook_updates.trigger: First AI race victory (P11→P1, zero incidents, strategic patience approach)
guidebook_updates.principle: Strategic race-start patience: operate at 80-90% pace Laps 1-2 to let field chaos settle, then deploy full speed Lap 4+ with clear targets identified

guidebook_updates.section: Part 4: The Enemy - Fear and Tension (The Fear Loop)
guidebook_updates.trigger: Post-season Rudskogen race: P5 quali → P2 → spun twice same corner (laps 3-4) defending position → P9
guidebook_updates.principle: Fear of being overtaken creates tension → tension creates jerky inputs → mistakes happen. Brain can't process negatives under pressure ('don't spin' = brain hears 'SPIN'). Need to practice 'meebewegen' (flow with pressure) consciously until automatic. Created 'Let Them By' drill for fear desensitization.
guidebook_updates.quote: It's not my pace, it's not my prep or my coach or my car or the others... most of the times it's me. And that can be fixed.
